title: Ticket #6201: isnt operator does not appear to be defined 8.6.1 manual
description:
In searching the manual for the precise behavior of the isnt operator, I found that it is only mentioned by example rather than as a proper operator. I presume it is shorthand for "\=!\="?

Hopefully you know what I mean as the equals sign is a special character in your markup language.
remarks:
2017-Mar-22 16:40:06 by tpdownes:
The "is" operator appears not to be used even by example. Are these deprecated?

2018-Sep-25 14:47:24 by gthain: 

   "is" and "isnt" are synonyms for the meta-equal and meta-not-equal operators =?= and =!=

These first started becoming valid synonyms when we made "new" classads the classad engine for condor in 8.2? As they don't provide any semantic difference, and it was possible that people were mixing and matching versions, we haven't gone our of our way to document them, but they do show up in funny places from time to time.

2018-Sep-26 13:57:50 by tpdownes:
The takeaway for me is that "is" and "isnt" are new and not going away rather than that they are ancient and could disappear.

Let me know if that's wrong. It reads much more "Pythonically" so I prefer to use them.

2018-Sep-26 16:04:45 by johnkn:
Correct, they are not old and going away, they are new as of 7.x (7.2 I think?) and not going away.
check_ins: 2018-Oct-23 11:01   Check-in [55608]: Add is and isnt into the HTCondor classad section of the manual. #6201 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
creator: tpdownes
